p:
The area sum (%) of fatty acid esters (linolenate (ω-3), linoleate (ω-6) and oleate (ω-9)) was around 86% ( Table 3). The remaining 14% may be related to the amounts of both palmitic and stearic acids. Studies in the literature of fatty acid composition from linseed oil showed 45.1–73.4% linolenic, 11.9–20% linoleic, 17.1–24.3% oleic, 4.6–6.9% palmitic and 0.25–4.6% stearic acids (
21 -
23 ).
